description.en:
Applied Creative Destruction Lab with Startups is a hands-on course about commercializing technological innovation. Students, who have learned the theory of startup strategy, scaling, and financing, apply this theory by working closely with early-stage technology ventures in the CDL program performing precisely those tasks. 

Participation in CDL-Estonia meetings offers students frequent interaction with experienced entrepreneurs and investors. In particular, you will apply analytical frameworks that are useful for addressing the following issues:
1. how can startups determine if they are providing value to customers,
2. why do some startups capture that value and others do not,
3. what is the role of experimentation for startups,
4. what makes high-growth startup financing unique,
5. how can startups evaluate market size and potential for new goods,
6. how do you compute the value of a startup,
7. how should startups run pilots, tests, and other early customer interactions,
8. What are different pricing forms and strategies and how should startups choose the right one for their business.

Our expectations for you are exceedingly high both because our goal with the course is to prepare you to work in the startup ecosystem after you graduate and because this course has you work hands-on with real startups and engage directly with the CDL program. We require rigorous preparation before each class. In our class exercises, we demand rigorous logical application of theoretical ideas to cases. You will provide actual strategic assistance the assigned company. 

Throughout the year, we will be visited by guests including prominent venture capitalists and startup founders. You will have the opportunity to ask them questions and we expect that you will come to these sessions well prepared, with questions that are relevant to the topic being discussed and the speaker's background.
description.et:
Creative Destruction Lab praktikaklass iduettevõttega on tehnoloogilise innovatsiooni kommertsialiseerimise praktiline läbi tegemine. Üliõpilased, kel on piisav teoreetiline ettevalmistus iduettevõte strateegiast, skaleerimisest ja rahastamisest, rakendavad seda konkreetse CDL programmis osaleva iduettevõtte jaoks. Üliõpilane on pidevas kontaktis nii ettevõttega (kuigi see pole klassikaline praktika), mentoritega kui ka investoritega. Üliõpilane lahendab vastavalt konkreetse iduettevõtte ees seisvatele väljakutsetele järgmisi ülesandeid:
1. selgitada välja, kas ja kuivõrd luuakse klientidele väärtust,
2. kuidas väärtuse loomine pöörata rahaks,
3. mis on eksperimenteerimise roll iduettevõtluses,
4. mille poolest on kasvuettevõtte rahastamine eriline,
5. kuidas määratleda turu suurust ja uue toote potentsiaali,
6. kuidas arvutada ettevõtte väärtust,
7. kuidas piloteerida, testida ja juhtida varaseid kliendikontakte,
8. millised hinnastamise mudelid ja strateegiad eksisteerivad ning kuidas nende vahel valida.

Kursusel osalevale üliõpilasele on seatud kõrged ootused, sest programmis arendatakse reaalset iduettevõtet, kes ootab ja vajab tegelikku abi, ning peale kursuse läbimist peaks üliõpilane olema iseseisvalt valmis osalema iduettevõtluse ökosüsteemis. Igaks kohtumiseks eeldatakse põhjalikku ettevalmistust, ülesanne defineeritakse ettevõtte ja mentorite poolt. Aasta jooksul külastavad programmis osalejaid tuntud riskikapitalistid ja iduettevõtete loojad.

objectives.en:
The Applied Creative Destruction Lab with Startups is a 6-credit course in entrepreneurship in which students will work with the Creative Destruction Lab (CDL) Estonia team to help emerging digital society focused start-ups.
As a result, the student becomes equipped to work productively and successfully in the startup world. Students will learn about the formation, financing and management of massively scalable companies through a series of close interactions with early-stage technology companies in the CDL, and their potential seed investors.
objectives.et: Creative Destruction Lab praktikaklass iduettevõttega on 6 EAP-ne ettevõtlusalane kursus kahes osas, kus üliõpilased töötavad Creative Destruction Lab (CDL) Eesti meeskonnaga digitaalse ühiskonna iduettevõtte arendamise eesmärgil. Kursuse läbimine annab üliõpilasele ettevalmistuse edaspidi iseseisvalt iduettevõtluses osalemiseks, sest läbitakse praktiliselt ettevõtte loomise, rahastamise ja juhtimise etapid koos programmi hoolikalt valitud ambitsioonika iduettevõtte, rahvusvaheliste rahastajate ja mentoritega.

learning_outcomes.en:
After taking the course students can
- conduct market analysis,
- formulate and communicate value proposition and business plan
- define a product development plan including all useful organizational elements needed to enact the plan.
learning_outcomes.et:
Peale kursuse läbimist üliõpilane oskab
- koostada turuanalüüsi,
- formuleerida ja kommunikeerida väärtuspakkumist ning äriplaani,
- koostada tootearendusplaani koos ellu viimiseks vajalike organisatsiooniliste elementidega.

grade_evaluation.et:
Participation 

Assignments given by the venture
Your performance is evaluated based on feedback from the group members and venture about your contribution.

Attending two full-day sessions of the Creative Destruction Lab (CDL) and bi-weekly seminars.

You can pass the course with at least 70% evaluation.

arvestatud.et: Work plan has been successfully executed in collaboration with the venture or the CDL team, student has attended at least 5 bi-weekly seminars, and the CDL session #4.

mittearvestatud.et: Work plan has not been executed, or student has not participated at least 5 bi-weekly meetings.

name.et: Moore, Crossing the Chasm, Leslie and Holloway, "The Sales Learning Curve" in HBR (1996) (https://hbr.org/2006/07/the-sales-learning-curve)
Readings Three essays by Paul Graham (http://www.paulgraham.com/): Why Startup Hubs Work, Can You Buy a Silicon Valley?, Why Move to a Startup Hub?

name.en: Chair of Public Economics and Policy

description.et:
Working with the venture (week 24-39)

Expected outcome: fulfilling the previously agreed work plan. Submitting reports to the venture and receiving feedback and guidance.
Students will meet every second week to present their cases and progress, share success and concerns. Solve problems.

Attending CDL session #4 in Tallinn on May 20 2025. 
Meeting with startups and mentors in person.

During the final seminar on week 39 we will look back to the process, reflect on the learnings and make plans for the future. 
Submitting your summarizing reflection on the course and learnings.

audience.et: Obligatory to pass 1 part of course first.
